item.title: Halp! My command is being gay, please
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

Use the equalsIgnoreCase() method from the String class so you don’t have to worry about the typing syntax (worrying about which char to capitalize). You also need to remove the current ‘::’ as it’s already handled in the client; to do the command you would have to type: ‘::::bySap’ which is dumb.

Read full topic

@TimmahPwnz wrote:

No No, i put it like that so you can see the difference between commands so they dont get confusing, lol
on this 562 server, it goes if (cmd[0].equals("::command")) {
i think that about covers it…

item.title: Halp! My command is being gay, please
item.dc:creator: @monkey_money30 monkey money30
item.description:
@monkey_money30 wrote:

Mabey because commands a caps-sensitive, in game you may be doing ‘::buysap’ when really it’s ‘::buySap’?

Also:

if (cmd[0].equals("::buySap")) {

Don’t you do:

if (cmd[0].equals("buysap")) {

??? or do you do ::buysap?

item.title: Halp! My command is being gay, please
item.dc:creator: @TimmahPwnz TimmahPwnz
item.description:
@TimmahPwnz wrote:

Okay so i have used Atomic-562 Source, now i’ve found a code and it doesnt produce errors, but it wont work

All of these get NO errors, but still don’t work.

if (player.getInventory().contains(995, 100)) {
if (player.getInventory().contains(995, 100));
player.getInventory().contains(995, 100);

Command:

if (cmd[0].equals("::buySap")) {
    if (player.getInventory().contains(995, 100)) {
	player.getInventory().deleteItem(995, 100);
	    player.getInventory().addItem(1623, 1);
		player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You Recieve An Uncut Sapphire");
	}
}

Also this is a code, but i don’t know how to use it…

if (player.getInventory().contains(new Item(item, amount));

Any help would be great thanks.

  • Tim
